comments.commentBody: I'd bet money that you're fine with Trump droning on about a wall along the Mexican border while U.S. citizens struggle with the impact of drought, flood, fire etc.
pataclant  - I am with you, provided there is evidence that Trump is stable enough to rely on informed and experienced sources.  And that he will stop tweeting dares to Kim Jong.

1) According to the article, we are in this mess despite the best efforts of the Obama administration, so why are most of the commentators attacking Trump?

2) If the article is correct, we're all doomed anyway, so what does it matter whose fault it is?

The thought that Trump is in charge of complex foreign policy issues like North Vietnam is frightening. There is nothing in his past experience that prepared him for anything like this.
This man , who cares about nothing but his business empire,getting re elected and above all his inflated ego is a time bomb waiting to explode.
Bad.
Think Obama, community organizer.
It seems that Arnold Schwarzenegger and The Celebrity Apprentice are on Trump's mind more than North Korea. Don't blame the Democrats.

I am beginning to see the point Trump was making that he has inherited a mess that he did not think he was inheriting. He own the mess now and needs to try putting pressure on North Korea via China and Russia.
And for that, he was naive. Any citizen who pays attention to foreign affairs knows of the increasing threat of a North Korean ICBM.
Trump did not think he was inheriting the problem of N. Korea? The sad part is that somehow, I find that totally believable.
Trump will finds scares many things left behind by Obama!

"China craves border security above all else, and they don't trust that our military presence in South Korea is not a pretext to launch an offensive on China via the Korean peninsula."

"Offensive on China?" Why? To what end? China is already a nuclear power. That is a feigned fear hiding some other objective.
Apparently, Trump believed that his successor on the Apprentice was a more pressing issue.

North Korea is not going to use nuclear weapons against anyone. Kim Jong-Un has one goal, and that is to remain in power. The fastest way for him to lose his power is to start a war, because North Korea will lose that war quickly and he knows it. Kim stays in power by doing two things:

1. Toeing the line of making the world afraid enough to pay attention to them (which helps acquire aid and feeds into their nationalistic narrative), but not so afraid that they get attacked.

2. Keeping the people happy and ignorant enough that they don't revolt. This depends on tight control of outside influence, propaganda, trade with China, and foreign aid.

So Kim faces two perpetually growing threats: attack from the outside, and revolt from within. Even though he may present himself as a nut-job that could do anything at any moment, the reality is that the Kim regime hasn't managed to stay in power for all these decades by being impulsive and irrational. They have stayed in power because they know how to play politics. It's all they have. They are poor as dirt and would be utterly irrelevant on the international landscape if it weren't for their nuclear program, and THAT is the reason for all the saber-rattling. If we want to see North Korea fall with the least number of casualties, we should be discussing how to help get information IN and potential high-ranking defectors OUT.

Actually we have more than 3, a nuclear exchange between India and Pakistan would likely be fatal for the rest of the world, Israel has the capability to initiate the Sampson Option should their survival be threatened, and if you look at the circles in this article North Korea might be gaining the same type of response and of course there is Iran where we pretty much have a hold on them as the article suggests and they are willing at least to come to the table.  It is in not only China's interest but also Russia, Japan, the far east countries, and the US to insist that North Korea come to the table now.  Right now North Korea is a pariah and if you ever looked at it from space at night you would notice one thing, North Korea is dark.  Wow what a market!!  So there might be a little wiggle room for negotiation, but we have to press it.  If we don't then it makes no sense for the government of North Korea to survive in it's present configuration and it's nuclear capabilities must be terminated.  Do we have the will for that?

Or maybe, instead of cutting non-military budgets to the bone, some cultural and student exchange programs?  So there might be some understanding among some North Koreans that our sole reason for being isn't to destroy them?

It seems the leader of North Korea has anticipated this action and is taking steps to eliminate any credible alternative leader who could be installed in his place - by assassinating his half brother just a week ago.
The murder of Un's half brother and execution of his uncle demonstrates that any friendship with China is no guarantee of peace in East Asia.

Nice comment but one thing is not correct. Korea can not be friendly to China, either China is. Not because we hate each other but location of korea peninsula is critical to China. If you search about the history of China even a little, you will understand they have logical fear to neighbors. So they always strives to put neighbors under their control and civilization, and currently Korea is the most dangerous one. Yet, of course Koreans have no tiny wish for going back to past.
It s nothing new. We are repeating this since beginnig of history..a sad story

What's just as frightening as North Korea is our Commander-in-Chief's blasé Tweet, "It won't happen!". Sorry Donald, you just can't "fire" North Korea.
There seem to be a few serious, competent people in this sorry excuse for a government, let's hope they can work with the Chinese to put a leash on North Korea.

The US very easily could encourage and assist South Korea to become possessors, entirely on their own, of submarines armed with nuclear missiles. One wonders how quickly China would react in pacifying North Korea if they knew, for certain, that not doing so would put South Korea in that balancing position within months.

I described the options, not how they should be planned and carried out. That is for those whose job it is to implement them. If we let madmen have their way there will be no end to it. Of course there will be a price to pay but better that than cringe in the face of evil. The same applies to the Teheran Mullahs and their missile program.

Kim Jong-un is even crazier than his predecessors and perhaps the most dangerous man in the world. Perhaps save one--our president.
For the first time, I feel this leaked information is inappropriate--not because of the public but because of him.
I have always wondered what wold happen if we fed the North Koreans and gave them aid, just as I wondered what would happen if we traded with Cuba.

Surely, any society sophisticated enough to develop nuclear weapons and ballistic missiles must comprehend the consequences of using them. When you are a small player in the game, like North Korea or potentially Iran, you have no realistic expectation that launching an armed rocket would cripple your opponent and prevent a retaliatory strike. Taking the offensive would insure the utter destruction of one's country, sort of suicide by launch. Unless the leader of such a country were truly insane, as opposed to merely being a posturing blowhard, he or she would understand that even a failed launch would unleash such a massive response that it would be unthinkable to even try it. This fact alone vitiates my fears of a nuclear strike against the US or one of our allies.

Even supporters need to admit that Trump is demonstrating total incompetence in his handling of this overall situation. Mr. "Sophisticated Business Genius" continues to prove every day just how far in over his head he is in this job.

I think DT is heading in the same direction as Mr. Richard Nixon went before by imploding actions rather than external forces.The pattern is well set- from election campaign, conflict of interests, Appointment to key positions of persons who are cannot be trusted, huge Russian involvement in the campaign,Killing initiated racial hatred, poorly thought out presidential orders, ridiculing of very judges who uphold the constitution to resulting 100 days of utter confusion. Hope, some semblance of good governance will remain to uphold the respect of a great powerful democracy & its liberties.Law makers & the GOP must do the right thing by the people in upholding truth, righteousness & respect for Law in the highest office for the people of America.Ensure that democratic process is not derailed. No one is above the Law.

People always pay attention to a clown. Fortunately for the nation, this is the first time a clown got elected by fake news, fear mongering, cheap rhetoric, manipulation and help from KGB. He is mentally unstable - says one thing in the morning and changes the same in the evening. He is a master mind manipulator. The con man plays the us vs them game very well. It can only change if only people take out their blindfold and  see the true color of him. Our great nation is at danger- people wake up.

People eventually get tired of combativeness for its own sake. Trump will gradually alienate all but his most hard-core base. He will lose Congress in 2018 and he will lose re-election in 2020.

Meanwhile, don't blame me for the mess we're in - I voted for Hillary Clinton.

politicsbyeccehomo.wordpress.com

Nope. It's how he will win. He knows exactly what he's doing, and that is manipulating the press so they follow all the scandals instead of reporting on facts and policies. He is the epitome of "there's no such thing as bad publicity."
Except for truly major ideas, Trump should be on page 3 by now, instead of the front page.

Perhaps the key is to ignore everything Trump says and only pay attention to what he does -- both acts of commission and omission. After all Trump's political success may be a symptom of a bigger problem, our 45 year decline in family purchasing power.

The greatest weapon against a narcissist is to act as if they don't exist -- I know because I tried it and it left an indelible impression on the target, permanently puncturing their ego balloon.

Then we will be free to concentrate on reversing the decline in family purchasing power in the face of automation, globalization, breaching of natural limits and reformation of monopolies.
